file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-26-01-04 - SINGLE INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SINGLE INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the Inertial Reference Unit (IRU). B. The IRU is installed on the left side of the electronic compartment. C. The access to the IRU is got through access panel 113CZ in the forward electronic compartment. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - RE- ALL 34-26-01-000-801-A MOVAL INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - IN- ALL 34-26-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-26-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-26-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the Inertial Reference Unit (IRU). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Forward electronic compartment - LH 213 113CZ upper side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install the safety pin of the NLG-door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-26-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) On the circuit breaker panel, open the IRS circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (5) On the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (the striped bar comes on). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the two knurled clamp knobs (2) until they are disconnected from the support hooks. (2) Remove the IRU (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-26-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Inertial Reference Unit (IRU) - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 213 214 DET. A 1. IRU DET. B 2. KNURLED CLAMP KNOB 145AMM340445.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-26-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-26-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. INERTIAL REFERENCE UNIT (IRU) - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the Inertial Reference Unit (IRU). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-26-00-700-801-A/500 SINGLE IRS - OPERATIONAL TEST SINGLE IRS - MOUNTING TRAY LEVELING/ALIGN- AMM TASK 34-26-00-700-802-A/500 MENT SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Forward electronic compartment - LH 213 113CZ upper side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: WHEN YOU PUT THE UNIT ON THE MOUNTING TRAY, DO NOT FORCE FIT. IF MATING IS DIFFICULT, REMOVE THE UNIT AND MAKE SURE THAT THE CONNECTOR PINS ARE NOT BENT OR OUT OF ALIGNMENT. ALSO, VISUALLY EXAMINE THE ALIGNMENT OF THE RECEPTACLE ON THE MOUNTING TRAY. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-26-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Put the IRU (1) on the mounting tray. Move it onto the three guide pins. Move the unit rearward until its connectors are fully engaged with the mating connectors of the mounting tray. (2) Tighten the knurled clamp knobs (2) over the support hooks to attach the unit in position. NOTE: If the mounting tray is moved out of position, a complete mounting tray alignment must be done ( AMM TASK 34-26-00-700-802-A/500). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG-door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the IRS circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it. (4) On the electrical panel, on the overhead panel, push the BACKUP pushbutton (striped bar comes off). (5) Do the Single IRS operational test (AMM TASK 34-26-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-26-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
